title: International Children’s Book Day
detail_text: <:th_ch0107/>Emma-san, do you think this book would be good to read to the children at the temple today?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Wow! I love this book! I’m sure they’ll love it~!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0107/>Ehehe, that’s great, zura~. Maru also loves this book~. When I was a kid, I always wanted to be able to talk to animals…<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>I still do, even now! I wish I could understand what Neve-chan was saying to me...<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0107/>Is Neve-chan the name of the baby goat from where you lived, Emma-san?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>That’s right~. She was always so friendly, and whenever my younger sisters would read to her, she’d always quietly listen... Oh, that reminds me, I’ve read this book before!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0107/>It sounds like Neve-chan could understand you, Emma-san.<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Hmhm, that’d be really nice~. Every time I see Neve-chan, I always tell her how much I love her!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0107/>Your life sounds like a fairy tale, zura~. Maru would like to write a fairy tale with you as the main character, Emma-san~<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Oh, please do~! I’d gladly read it when it’s finished!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0000/>Translated by SIFAStheatre and Idol Story<:dt_line_end/>
